misc/gods/aos-baia.html.title: Aos Baia
misc/gods/aos-baia.html.description: Represents: Dawn, Fertility/Birth, and Domesticity continent the creature avasoryd avincatp sleeping vani EYES ourselves WATCHING vani WATCHING WATCHING WATCHING Creature grasp? hands? ??? us hands tendrils guys wrestling tendrils us opened mouth "anything we can call you" stars and constellations that cant be translated the world has opened up a wave as the water of the new world meets the old and our world pushes out like a tsunami as it returns its rightful place sinani and solace's mark changes to a sun peaking out behind the moon students of the magic academy of tawdrywilde to investigate the remains of a creature, ice and snow 1-20 sent on a ship expedition to an island chain to the south west, pieces of a great battle of a cosmic scale above it, each island struggling w a different effect, lots of travel 1-15/20 set just after this game, playing religious folk of the holy order (just below a bishop), from a capital, considering what to do now that the bubble is gone, what that means religiously, now that we'll be getting contacted by interesting and talkative beings members of the pale order, the bubble bursts an the queen sends ships to distant lands. the order is finally gaining ground 1-20 wayfinders! 1-10

misc/groups/children-of-the-umbral-mothe.title: Children of the Umbral Mother
misc/groups/children-of-the-umbral-mothe.description: These followers of Nex Umbra across all her incarnations work to defeat undeath and free souls. They are currently in the most concentration working with the Order of the Pale in Halcystead.

misc/groups/crystalwater-sages.html.title: Crystalwater Sages
misc/groups/crystalwater-sages.html.description: The sages of Crystalwaters have training with the potent crystalline energy of the area, creating a new form of magic.

misc/groups/gang-enforcer.html.title: Gang Enforcer
misc/groups/gang-enforcer.html.description: There are a number similar of organized crime syndicates across Avasoryd, with none particularly standing out above the rest.

misc/groups/gilded-stags.html.title: Gilded Stags
misc/groups/gilded-stags.html.description: Spies who were recruited from the great bard college in the The Great, Holy, and Pious Alliance of Kingdoms

misc/groups/grove-druids.html.title: Grove Druids
misc/groups/grove-druids.html.description: Vinry and Oaky

misc/groups/halikian-farmers-guild.html.title: Halikian Farmers Guild
misc/groups/halikian-farmers-guild.html.description: Followers of Circaea Halikila that move refuges from country to country, typically all the way to Easterglen. The organization also contains a number of farmers who primarily farm, but also assist in transporting and hiding those in need.

misc/groups/kai-family.html.title: Kai Family
misc/groups/kai-family.html.description: The Kai Family is a family of humans whose ancestors once lived in the Plane of Air serving a great and evil air elemental. His great evil cursed them, causing them to emit sot-like smoke. They aren’t welcome in many other countries and found Bluewall the only place they could live comfortably. Any Sylphs, regardless of ancestry, who manifest this strange miasma are happily adopted into the family. Children born of this family who do not find themselves covered in cloying fog are quickly sent off the island.

misc/groups/maelstrom-family.html.title: Maelstrom Family
misc/groups/maelstrom-family.html.description: Lastly, there are the water dwelling Maelstrom Family. Originally from Levinea , their ancestor fell in love with one of the Nereids who lived near the cursed island. The original ancestor could not bear the curse and got sick often. But the Nereid crafted them a heart shaped amulet that protected them from both the Nereids touch and the curse of the island. When their children were born, they were innately able to withstand the islands‘ curse.

misc/groups/maronda-shipping-company.htm.title: Maronda Shipping Company
misc/groups/maronda-shipping-company.htm.description:
Run by D'Volta Aomar
prev had connections to The Holy Order of the Lawful Patriarch and Blackfrost

misc/groups/olaf-family.html.title: Olaf Family
misc/groups/olaf-family.html.description: The Olaf Family is descended from a clan of Azoicmound alchemists and brewers. Their ancient founder was accused of plotting against the core tenants of the country and her entire family was to be sent to death. They escaped and fled to the island, willing to risk its curse only to find they were not affected by it.

misc/groups/order-of-the-pale.html.title: Order of the Pale
misc/groups/order-of-the-pale.html.description: Dedicated to stopping the Sanguine Queen of Necromere. Historically a part of The Holy Order of the Lawful Patriarch and it’s predecessors, these knights branched off and formed their own organization when the Lawful Order failed to take action in around the year 300, allowing the Sanguine Queen to rise to power and destroy a significant portion of Halcystead.

misc/groups/sanguine-queensguard.html.title: Sanguine Queensguard
misc/groups/sanguine-queensguard.html.description: The Sanguine Queen of Necromere hosts an assassin organization. They nominally are her guard, but in actuality take contracts on the lives of others to bring gold back to the Queen.

misc/groups/students-of-the-serene.html.title: Students of the Serene
misc/groups/students-of-the-serene.html.description: Students of Vidrin the Serene in The Grove of Cycles.

misc/groups/tawdrywilde-tamer.html.title: Tawdrywilde Tamer
misc/groups/tawdrywilde-tamer.html.description: It requires great skill to tame the megafauna that the people of Tawdrywilde live alongside. These skilled people are known as Tawdrywilde Tamers.

misc/groups/tehmian'-detectives.html.title: Tehmian' Detectives
misc/groups/tehmian'-detectives.html.description: Based out of the grand city of Tehmia, these detectives investigate crimes against Tehmia’s citizens and the The Holy Order of the Lawful Patriarch.

misc/groups/the-hand-of-the-lawful-patri.title: The Hand of the Lawful Patriarch
misc/groups/the-hand-of-the-lawful-patri.description: Known holders: Rithous Valificus the 3rd
misc/groups/the-hand-of-the-lawful-patri.sourcePath: Misc/Groups/The Hand of the Lawful Patriarch.md

misc/groups/the-raven’s-wings.html.title: The Raven’s Wings
misc/groups/the-raven’s-wings.html.description: The elite guard of The Raven King A specific fighting style passed down by these elite guards. The sword looks like the feathers of a raven, giving it the name Ravenwing Blade or Ravenfeather Sword.

misc/groups/the-swashbuckler-society.htm.title: The Swashbuckler Society
misc/groups/the-swashbuckler-society.htm.description: Formed by Lyldaa the Lucky, this guild of swashbucklers fight ostentatious for the ideals of freedom and good. Physically being able to fight with a rapier on a boat is not important to them, being a member of the Swashbuckler Society is typically more about your heart and your flair for dramatics. They are currently based in Welterglow, although they’ve been banned from the capital trade port.

misc/groups/the-wayfinders.html.title: The Wayfinders
misc/groups/the-wayfinders.html.description: Named after their signature magical compasses, the Wayfinders explore Avasoryd, especially long forgotten places. They focus on collaborating and writing down their findings so that the knowledge they’ve gained won’t be forgotten. They are a theoretically apolitical organization.

misc/groups/venian-knights.html.title: Venian Knights
misc/groups/venian-knights.html.description: A group of knights decided to order above all. Most of them are from The Great, Holy, and Pious Alliance of Kingdoms , Easterglen , and Azoicmound.

misc/pantheons/atheists.html.title: Atheists
misc/pantheons/atheists.html.description: Organization Structure: None, not an organized religion. No central tenants of belief other than deity/religious organization skepticism.Opinion on Chosen/Marked: Natural phenomenon / invented by the church.Notable Beliefs: Deity's don't exist/represent natural phenomena/used as a way to manipulate public. Note: Since this is not an organized religion this is just a general opinions. Notably popular in Fallencall

misc/pantheons/the-druidic-order-of-bloo.title: The Druidic Order of Blood and Brine
misc/pantheons/the-druidic-order-of-bloo.description: Organization Structure: Local druids lead religious ceremonies, council of oldest and powerful druids make sweeping decisions. Large influence on Raider's actions/diplomatic endeavors.Opinion on Chosen/Marked: They are marked as sacrifices to the gods. Great honor and luck is bestowed on the family of one who kills.Notable Beliefs: Magical Strength > Physical Strength > "Weak" people. Survival of the fittest/spartan attitude. Pelagus Fors as patriarch/central figure (happens to be seen as a man, gender is not particularly of concern to them). Skill and strength > anything else. Settling down seen as sign of weakness.
misc/pantheons/the-druidic-order-of-bloo.sourcePath: Misc/Pantheons/The Druidic Order of Blood and Brine.md

misc/pantheons/the-holy-order-of-the-law.title: The Holy Order of the Lawful Patriarch
misc/pantheons/the-holy-order-of-the-law.description:
Organization Structure: Hierarchy that spans across a great distance. Every person in the religion theoretically has someone in charge of them. The head of the religion is Venatus Tehmos in theory, but practically it is the person in the position of the The Hand of the Lawful Patriarch.Opinion on Chosen/Marked: They are avatars of our deities and should be trained and leveraged for the benefit of the order.
Notable Beliefs: Sisters are children of Venatus and Tempestas Filinna. Men > women, marriage 1-1, importance on childbirth and familial structure. Men as patriarchs. Sex for procreative purposes. Proselytizing important/required.
misc/pantheons/the-holy-order-of-the-law.sourcePath: Misc/Pantheons/The Holy Order of the Lawful Patriarch.md

misc/pantheons/the-lovers.html.title: The Lovers
misc/pantheons/the-lovers.html.description: Organization Structure: Married pairs as religious leaders, larger communities value 8 equal people as religious leaders. Council's of married people are important.Opinion on Chosen/Marked: The marks indicate 4 pairs of soulmates. It would be silly to use them for political gain.Notable Beliefs: There are two deities each with 4 cyclical aspects. Ideal 2/4/8 adult marriages/family units. Family unit > Everyone else. Kindness/charity important. Judgment of non-married/romantically active people.

misc/pantheons/the-pantheon-of-earth-and.title: The Pantheon of Earth and Stone
misc/pantheons/the-pantheon-of-earth-and.description: Organization Structure: Subterranean clan heads serve as religious and kingdom leaders.Opinion on Chosen/Marked: Born with intrinsic artistic/engineering talent. Should be protected and given some drafting parchment!Notable Beliefs: Important to live within/near mountains. Living outside of mountains for farming purposes noble/necessary sacrifice. Ingenium Metis center of the pantheon. No sexual dimorphism between deities. Art (sculpture/architecture) is one of the noblest pursuits. Regular citizens can be raised to nobility through artistic talent. Lack of routine engineering maintenance is one of the greatest sins. Community > all else.
misc/pantheons/the-pantheon-of-earth-and.sourcePath: Misc/Pantheons/The Pantheon of Earth and Stone.md

misc/pantheons/the-sisters-of-primordial.title: The Sisters of Primordial Chaos
misc/pantheons/the-sisters-of-primordial.description: Organization Structure: Groups tied only by belief across several nations. No official head of religion. Local community leaders of faith only.Opinion on Chosen/Marked: They are avatars of our deities and should be allowed to do as they please unimpeded. Training or attempting to influence them for your own purposes is deeply frowned on.Notable Beliefs: The Sisters are the oldest deities. There are deities/beings older than the Sisters. Focus on independence (no formal religious laws/sins) and relation between self and deities. Proselytizing frowned upon. Family > Community > Self.

misc/puzzle-1.html.title: Puzzle 1
misc/puzzle-1.html.description:
Lucius Valerius: Here's your tea, no don't stand I'll bring it to you. Rest!
Vivian: Ah... thank you. LV: How are you feeling? VV: Tired... I've been so tired, just sitting up in bed makes me winded. LV: Oh... goodness. Do you have any idea what might be the cause? VV: My curse... I think. It takes so long to regain my strength these days. LV: Of course, of course. Well, now that the grimoire has been written, at the very least you can rest for a bit.
VV: I must... show it to Eoghan Lark... he must safekeep it while I am gone. LV: I have.... some terrible news for you. VV: What is it?
LV: Your husband has... fled Grimwood. He's been accused of burning the Sacred Grove. VV: No.... it's not possible. His life force is tied to that grove. LV: He's gone, Vivian, I'm sorry. VV: No.... it can't be... I must... speak with my family now. LV: Of course, I'll help you to the crypt. Would it ease your mind for me to look after the grimoire? VV: No, no, I wouldn't want to burden you. LV: It would be no trouble at all, truly. Where is it now? VV: Safe.... hidden. I must pray to my family now. LV: Of course... let's go.

npcs/former-pcs/sinani/sinani.html.title: Sinani
npcs/former-pcs/sinani/sinani.html.description:
Eidolon: Solace Appearance: 5'11" Shaved, blonde hair Several moles across his face Pale grey eyes Glowing symbol of Nex Umbra on chest when eidolon, Solace, is summoned Home area:
Fallencall God you belong to:
Nex Umbra
The Grove of Cycles, Grove DruidsSPOILERS Notable history (that church knows): Was first seen in public after the necromancer Caius was attacked in his home, resulting in the building nearly burning completely to the ground.
Reports of seeing him (lost and confused, often mistaken for Caius Thaine) went as far as northern Barrenbreak. Put up a Huge Fight when the Church went to capture him, but he begrudgingly settled down when he found out they weren't attacking him. Public religious beliefs: "The Church's beliefs are like, fine, I guess?" says local man who slogged through several old ass books repeating the same story over and over again. He's knowledgable enough about the story that he can discuss with others who fully believe in what the Church believes at length. Private beliefs: The gods may represent different aspects of the world, but they clearly don't intervene where they should. He's still not 100% certain that the gods even actually exist and his Nex Umbra mark isn't just an elaborate setup by some sort of wizard. Time since capture: Roughly 2 years Important family and friends:
Caius Thaine - A necromancer who shares almost the exact same features as Sinani, almost as if they were reflections of each other. 5'11" Blonde hair that falls just below his shoulders Several moles across his face Pale grey eyes Looks like he hasn't seen the sun in weeks Dreams and aspirations: Stopping the rise of necromancy (as someone who has seen a necromancer in action) Expand his (modern) knowledge of the world Stop being put in Caius' shadow/fix the problems he caused Find out what Solace's connection to Nex Umbra is and why he was chosen How old are you: - Physically, like, 25. - Actual is like 2.5 Finally get a chance to rest and really delve into what his new meaning for existence is. He wants to understand why Solace came to him with the mark from Nex Umbra. He wants to learn more about the world, more than what would be found in largely outdated books. What would your character be doing if they were not on this adventure? Likely trying to rally the people from under Caius to deal with him/his lackies. Probably wouldn't go very well due to the Sharing The Same Face situation, but, hey, most people haven't seen Caius face to face before! Why aren't they doing that now? It's better with friends and not endangering the general population :) Where are they from? Fallencall Who were they to the community they were from?
Caius's body double, somebody not needed until the Worst Possible Outcome happened to the Blackfrost. Who is their closest person? Where is that person right now?
A young elven woman named Rima Dahast was the first person who helped him in the Church. As a cleric of Aos Baia, she was quite kind in introducing him into the Church and answered any questions he had. He's not entirely sure what she's been up to, but presumably she's still with the Chuch. What’s the most impactful moment in your characters life so far? Meeting Solace! :3 Escaping Caius and seeing the Real World and how it's drastically different than what he was led to believe, only to be snatched back up by the Church. Learning about the Blackfrost plague and the people dying to it. What’s your characters goal? Stopping Caius and preventing the spread of the Blackfrost and finding out why he was chosen by Nex Umbra. What do you, as a player, want to get out of playing this character narratively? I wanted to play a character who's able to settle into his own skin and create a name for himself rather than be in someone else's shadow. I really like the concept of the "twin" of such an evil guy is actively going against him despite unintentionally taking advantage of the fact that they share a face to do so. I also really want to learn more about what the mirror realm entails and why the FUCK they are sending these beasts to fight these reflections. What do you, as a player, want to get out of this character from a mechanical/gameplay perspective? Big big dammy from Solace, while still being able to cast spells. :3 I like the concept of kind of being the martial and the support caster all in one From a story perspective, why is your character the class they are? Why aren’t they any other class? Due to being "born" from a reflection, he wasn't able to defeat Solace and instead accepted this strange mirror beast as his summons. How do your highest skills reflect your characters personality? Arcana due to essentially being a wizard's apprentice for a little while, and has since tried to absorb as much information on the magical arts to try and understand what the FUCK is going on in the world magically Athletics is from having to fucking BOOK IT whenever there had been the chance he was gonna get snatched up, and is now like. Okay. I guess I should actually try to not let them grab me like that again Intimidation is due to the fear the Blackfrost puts into people, which he's using by, yknow, sharing his face Describe your characters moral or ethical beliefs. What would have to happen for them to go against their morals? The dead shouldn't be desecrated, especially if they're normal people caught in the crossfire of stronger adventurers. (Korkau has been REALLY pushing this for him. Very uncomfortable with their Dead Snatching.) Lying & hiding the truth is okay, unless it actively puts others in immediate danger. Murder under self-defense is fine, but if you're just killing to kill you're not really... going to be on his good side. Magic is power. Those who have magic should be trying to help those who don't, and if you're not, you should have a good reason. His friends or innocents would have to have be being threatened for him to go against his morals. However, he's quicker to cave if his own life is directly on the chopping block. He still wants to live. He wants to learn and grow. Would Sin ever consider changing their face? Honestly? Yes. If given the chance, he's have his face changed permanently so he doesn't have to face the comparisons to Caius ever again. Who were they to the community when they traveled? The odd guy with a giant tiger who, despite it, shrunk away from strangers at first. Eventually, he did open up to those who probed a bit, and he was more than willing to help out when needed. Never stuck around long, though, and did seem to be looking over his shoulder at any possible moment as if he was worried he was being watched. Where did they travel before the church got them? As far south as the northernmost tip of the Lunahelm Raiders. Without a map or worldly experience, it's kind of hard to get anywhere, really. Which, in hindsight, is probably for the best since he probably wouldn't have been a good fit there. Tell me about your time as a wizards apprentice He was overseen as he was taught how to work on cadavers by various Blackfrost workers. Elbows deep in rotting carcasses, only to later see them mindlessly walking to the Blackfrosts' orders. He was terrible at the actual raising part of necromancy, which was definitely... not ideal, but not the worst; at least he had some magical ability. He couldn't imagine what they would have had him do if he didn't have Solace. What happened before you escaped? He tried to learn about the world as much as he could. Half of the information went right over his head, but when he wasn't being forced into doing anything, he was sneaking books, or speaking with Solace, or probing the Blackfrost lackies for information. How did you escape? He took full advantage of the attack to hide Solace and sneak away in the heat of the moment. Stolen cloak and knife, the dark of night, and wandering blindly until he found a passage that was probably supposed to be under guard and he was... out. It shocked him, too. He spent all night running away until he hid in some poor family's barn to sleep. He couldn't shake the feeling that they let him escape but... he's yet to find proof of tht. Did you get to know any members of the Blackfrost? Very few Blackfrost members actually treated him more than some soulless husk for Lord Caius. Some were mean when he asked questions. Some were nice. The very, very few actually pitied him into speaking with him like a human being. The closest he got to know was a halfling called Len. He's not sure if that was a nickname or his actual name, but Len treated him the most like a person. That doesn't mean he was treated well, but he was still treated like he had thoughts and opinions outside of Caius's own. Len was there because he was promised sanctuary from local law if he helped Lord Caius. Sinani managed to gleam that he did something quite bad but Len never let slip what exactly he did. What’s the worst thing sin would do to survive?
Give up Solace, part of his soul, even it hurt him in the end (and by god it would hurt both of them). Go back to the Blackfrost, if things went truly to hell. Would sin get rid of sol if given the chance? Probably not unless he had very good reason to. Sinani's gotten pretty attached to Solace, even despite the "magically attached to his soul" part.

npcs/former-pcs/acaro-cervus.html.title: Acaro Cervus

npcs/former-pcs/cecylia.html.title: Cecylia
npcs/former-pcs/cecylia.html.description:
SPOILERS Where are they from?
She's a runaway from a small farming community called Bredani in south east Fallencall. She was never a farmer, and she was never that good in the arcane magics, so her and her collection of trinkets and doodads were never... appreciated, she thought. Who were they to the community they were from? The little kid who'd rather dig through junk than help out. She's sweet, yeah, but you have to drag her out of the house and physically put her in the field to get her to do anything and even then she obviously hates doing it. She's basically just a child, and now she's run away. With Idris, she was just chatty little sidekick that followed him around and seemed to get on his nerves. Who is their closest person? Where is that person right now?
Idris Lanthorn. He took her in and taught her what he knew for the tools of the trade after she tried to scam him on a piece of junk she found that she knew was worth nothing. He's... well. You know where.
Lilika Naas. She's a gnomish woman that Cyl met in her brief time in Welterglow, who had actually spent time in the Swashbuckler Society before taking a small break to be on land. She taught Cyl the bare beginnings of the bardic craft, which she took to like a fish in water. What’s the most impactful moment in your characters life so far? The first week of actually living on her own, she hadn't realized how hard it would be. She'd expected it to be hard, but not this hard. One night, she had set up camp, sat down, and just started crying. She missed home, she missed people so bad, and she was this close to packing things back up and heading there. But after she stopped sniffling, she shook her head and promised herself that she'd be okay. That she was going to make her own home somewhere, she'd make friends and her own family, and she'll be okay. What’s your characters goal? Helping those who have been affected by the wizards and protecting them from being hurt once again. Bringing Idris back. What do you, as a player, want to get out of playing this character narratively? Learning that she has to actually 'grow up' and realize that she doesn't have to take every little thing on herself. That she can be strong, but she doesn't have to be if there are those willing to help. What do you, as a player, want to get out of this character from a mechanical/gameplay perspective? :woozy: Other people not dying. From a story perspective, why is your character the class they are? Why aren’t they any other class? She's no thaumaturge, but she does learn how to take advantage of her voice and knowledge as much as she can. She learnt fighting styles from Idris, and how to properly hold a knife, but she How do your highest skills reflect your characters personality? Learning from Idris, she's taken her charismatic personality and pushed it further. She's diplomatic, she's deceptive, and of course she can perform. Living on her own, she's been forced to learn how to subsist on the natural world. How does your character view themself? How do others view your character? She thinks she's... okay? She tries really hard! She's doing her best! But she's just... okay. Chatty, pushy, but overall a nice kid. Needs to figure out what she wants to do in life; she has so many years ahead of her. Describe your characters moral or ethical beliefs. What would have to happen for them to go against their morals? Edicts: Take the Long Road: Take a long-term perspective in all aspects of life. Uncover the hidden value of every trinket. Anathemas: Forsake Collaboration: Disdaining teamwork, refusing to learn from others, or acting solely for individual glory. Judge worth by surface shine. Rely on others to fight your battles Those she trusted abandon her, they refuse to help her in the resurrection of Idris, or they actively hurt her after she has helped them.

npcs/former-pcs/idris-lanthorn.html.title: Idris Lanthorn
npcs/former-pcs/idris-lanthorn.html.description:
Name: Idris Lanthorn Age: 28 Pronouns: he/him Appearance: SPOILERS What would your character be doing if they were not in wizard experiment hell? Same as he's always done: getting by by selling junk and useless trinkets to those who don't know any better. Why won’t they go back to doing that as soon as they escape? He's actually started to understand the junk he's collected can work well in a pinch. Sure, he could go back to selling junk, but why would he do that when he can actually get away with collecting stuff that actually works? Maybe he could actually find the break he's been looking for. Where are they from?
Here and there. It's hard to get an answer from him about it sometimes, but those who really push could probably figure he's from some little settlement at the southernmost coast of Welterglow. Probably. Who were they to the community they were from? Local conman pedaling mostly fake "magic items" with a penchant for getting into trouble he really shouldn't be getting into. Mostly known for being able to sweet talk his way out of the worst of it. Who is their closest person? Where is that person right now?
His apprentice, Cecylia. She's a young elven tiefling woman, around 19 y/o, with. He picked her up up not too long ago when she tried to scam him. They've become quite close, and he sees her quite a bit like family. She was out on a trip to a town in central Barrenbreak when he got taken; for all he knows, she thinks he's dead or has decided to leave her.
A distant cousin from Ravenyard, Ryker Maddox, who he's met and touched base with a couple of times. He's a good man, mostly, running a small company of bodyguards for hire. He's likely still there, if he hasn't taken up his next job. What’s the most impactful moment in your characters life so far? Beyond being captured and being experimented on by the wizards? The first time he got caught for selling someone a faulty piece of junk. He was only fourteen, voice cracks and all, and people trusted him. Heavily, in fact! He had that sort of trustworthy face. But he'll never forget the way that customer's face was distorted in rage as they chased him through the streets. He still chuckles thinking about it. Why do the wizards think they can get away with experimenting on your character? He's already such a willing test subject for the weird and the strange, though he didn't exactly expect his pedaling of totally legit "experimental" items would get him locked up in some wizards' test dungeon. Oops, that's his bad. How long have you been captured by them? Not long; probably six months at the best, a year at the worst. Time really blends together in there. What kind of experiments have they been conducting on you? Mutagens, magical items, and experimental talismans, mostly. The kind where you really don't want to be on the receiving end of; he's faced a good chunk magical backlash, but that's just allowed him to take the time to copy it all to memory and turn them back against those who captured him. How is this reflected by your class/background/mechanical choices? Thaumaturge collect the strange and turn it to their advantage. At level 2, I'll be taking the Talisman Esoterica feat to start being able to make talismans he remembers from the testing and using them to his advantage. What’s your characters goal beyond simply escaping? Expanding his occult knowledge to better understand why these things work the way they do. Additionally, he really wants to figure out what the end goal of all this experimentation is; he knows he's not the only one being experimented on, and frankly, he has some choice words and perhaps a punch to throw to whoever thought this all up. What do you, as a player, want to get out of playing this character narratively? I'm going back to my sleezey secrets era >:3 but really i wanted to create a character who could theoretically be idolized later in stories, but those who know him know he's kind of a shitty guy. What do you, as a player, want to get out of this character from a mechanical/gameplay perspective? i wanted to try something new! perhaps try a mix of mostly ranged martial with the ability to support + i wanted to mess around with familiars! From a story perspective, why is your character the class they are? Why aren’t they any other class? theoretically, he could have been a rogue, but his fascination with the occult was far greater than his wish to "legally take and sell" things. How do your highest skills reflect your characters personality? Deception being the highest for him... tracks the most with his conman tendencies. Thievery being his 2nd highest shows that he's not particularly the most trustworthy around potentially valuable items. How does your character view themself? How do others view your character? Reliable. A friend to those in need. A bit overly excessive at times, but who isn't? :) Full of himself. Sleezy. A nice guy at the best of times, a selfish asshole at the worst. Does still try his best when it comes down to it, but gods, must it really be when it comes down to it? Describe your characters moral or ethical beliefs. What would have to happen for them to go against their morals? Theft and dishonesty are a natural part of life. If either happen to you, you shouldn't be upset about it. The weak should be left alone; if you're picking on those who don't deserve it, you're worse than they'll ever be. Make him feel bad; not emotionally, he's been called far too many names to count. Torture or, at the very least, threaten bodily harm when he can't get away and you've got your man.

pcs/sunny-skies.html.title: Sunny Skies
pcs/sunny-skies.html.description:
SPOILERS Personally Questions What would your character be doing if they were not on this adventure? Probably searching the coast for the suitable thing or information to prove that she's "all grown up" now. She's been mapping the weather, sketching down animals and plants she sees, in the hopes that she finds that "just right" proof that she's worthy of being a druid. Why did they choose to take this boat? It’s not the first ship going out, it’s the first one headed south. It is not clear if there’s land in this direction. It's a learning experience, and it didn't want to miss out on what could be nature that adapted to a land different than it's home. She wants to prove to her old druid summoner that she's capable of using this life given to her for good, and if not, she'll be another addition to the nature of this new land. This boat was chosen specifically because she'd been in the area and it has some connections to her swashbuckling friends. Where are they from? She was created from a small, flowering lotus pond not too far off the coast of Amberreach. She came into her own person, and not a familiar, after traveling with her druid summoner for a long while. She found she quite enjoyed the life on the sea, surrounded by the Swashbuckler Society. Who were they to the community they were from? The little chipper flower leshy that was a bit too nosey for what it's able to do. It's eager to learn, but it's more interested in the sea around the boat than the actual boat itself. What has been the most impactful moment in your characters life so far? Falling overboard after goofing around too much. As scary as diving into the water was, she found that floating on the waves, surrounded by a new aspect of nature she had yet to experience was comforting. She almost tried to dive back in when they fished her out! What’s your characters goal? Learning as much as it can about the world the crew is sailing into, tracking as much of this and gaining life experience as it can until it's certain that the people that watched it come into it's own would be proud of who it's become.
What is your characters relationship with the Swashbuckler Society and the Maronda Shipping Company? It essentially "grew up" on one of the Swashbuckler Society's ships. Sunny's basically known sea-life longer than living on land. From a narrative perspective, why is your character the class they are? Why aren’t they any other class? Narratively, she's following in the footsteps of her original summoner. How do your highest skills reflect your characters personality? Medicine, Nature, and Survival all show that she is conscious of the environment around her and willing to protect it. It's happy to patch up her friends and those who have shown they're good to be around. Describe your characters personal edicts and anathemas. Come up with a situation where they would to go against these beliefs. Edicts: Record Natural Phenomena: Observe and keep a record of natural phenomena, animal behavior, plant growth patterns, and weather changes. Offer comfort in words - healing is more than physical. Experience the physical world. Take the Long Road: Take a long-term perspective in all aspects of life. Anathemas: Pollute the air, allow those who cause major air pollution or climate shifts to go unpunished. Despoil natural places, consume more natural resources than you require to live comfortably, teach the Wildsong to non-druids. Disturb Sacred Silence: Disrupt the natural silence of sacred groves or natural sanctuaries. For her to go against these beliefs, she would have to literally come to terms that she's going to go against some of the things that were drilled into her as she learnt how to be a druid. Player Questions What do you want to get out of playing this character narratively? I'm hoping to have a sweet & goofy little guy who ends up growing into someone who can be relied upon to help when you need it most. What do you want to get out of this character from a mechanical/gameplay perspective? Ideally assist my buddies with healing, the occasional support spell, and some whammy elemental damage. Campaign Questions What do you hope to see in this campaign? chances to utilize my speak w plants, i miss cipher puzzles a lot even if we do them outside of game, if theres anything abt the actually active gods id be quite interested but thats not super necessary What would you prefer not to have included in the campaign? specifically river boat combat.... i did not enjoy that much on sunday, otherwise we're p good

places/avasoryd/amberreach/amberreach.ht.title: Amberreach
places/avasoryd/amberreach/amberreach.ht.description:
This country was formed within the last few decades.It was previously part of Fallencall and ruled by a Wizard Lord who experimented on his population. His experiments on Goblins created Hobgoblins, with the intention for them to serve as his army.A band of his “subjects” rose up as folk heroes and deposed him. These heroes are still in charge of the country today.
Currently, the biggest threats facing the fledgling nation are border tensions with Fallencall, the ravenous merchants of Welterglow , and a smooth transition of power.
Emberhaven

places/avasoryd/azoicmound/azoicmound.ht.title: Azoicmound
places/avasoryd/azoicmound/azoicmound.ht.description: Azoicmound is defined by its relationship to The Great, Holy, and Pious Alliance of Kingdoms. It is the only country bordering the nation that is allied without being absorbed into it.This country has a long tradition of remaining relatively neutral in conflicts between world powers. The two countries stanch belief in law and belief ties them together, while their religious differences cause tension.Azoicmound is nominally a merit based society, where craftsmanship, hard work, and service are valued above all else. The country is primarily organized into various guilds and unions.

places/avasoryd/barrenbreak/barrenbreak..title: Barrenbreak
places/avasoryd/barrenbreak/barrenbreak..description:
Barrenbreak is made up of a number of primarily autonomous states. Each is traditionally run by the oldest members of their community, typically from one noble family or clan, and the country as a whole is overseen by one of the eldest representatives from each state. As such, change is slow to come. Trade is done mostly between individual underground cities, oddly enough Barren break does not seem to hold outside farmland, unlike other similarly underground countries.A number of mountain-dwelling communities, consisting mostly of strix and winter kitsune have recently become member states of Barrenbreak as well. Theres also a few dragons and other intelligent beasts whose caves and hordes have been legalized, categorized, and taxed. Despite being magical beats, these creatures are considered full citizens of Barrenbreak and have the full protection of the country behind them.In order to avoid costal raids, a lot of travel is conducted on the underground toll roads of Barrenbreak. They don't sanction anyone from any particular country from entering and using the road, but have yet to allow the armies of The Great, Holy, and Pious Alliance of Kingdoms or Azoicmound to traverse the tunnels.Attempts from Azoicmound clans have attempted to take a chunk out the outlying states, but cannot compete with the mastery of underground shown by the Barrenbreak skirmishers.
There is no state religion, rather each of the noble households has its own pantheon of minor deities. Azoicmound preachers are often found trying to sneak into Barrenbreak in order to spread the word of the The Pantheon of Earth and Stone .
Gadun

places/avasoryd/bluewall/bluewall.html.title: Bluewall
places/avasoryd/bluewall/bluewall.html.description:
Bluewall is a small island off the coast of Netherrim. The settlement on the island is surrounded, perhaps unsurprising, by a blue wall. It is debated among northern scholars if the wall is literal, magical, or even metaphorical.Only those with express permission are allowed entry to the city. Others are left outside the walls where the islands curse sickens them or driven away by the Nereid protectors of the area. The island used to be a part of Netherrim, but was cursed just the incident that led to the Netherrim wastes. Only a select few families being able to live upon it. It is unclear how the city provides itself with food and water, considering most crops are subject to the curse as well. Oddly enough, sometimes visitors are allowed on the island but there reports are must different than those of errant curse resistant family members. People presumed dead or missing have lived there many years, thought to be completely gone, only to suddenly return on a ship escorted by Nereids.Oddly enough, creatures of the opossum family are plentiful on the island. There are five main families that have freedom to enter and exit Bluewall.
The first is the Kanok Family. Long ago, they escaped the desolate lair of a Spirit Naga and fled to the island. Almost all members of the family have deep purple scales.
The Kai Family is a family of humans whose ancestors once lived in the Plane of Air serving a great and evil air elemental. His great evil cursed them, causing them to emit sot-like smoke. They aren’t welcome in many other countries and found Bluewall the only place they could live comfortably. Any Sylphs, regardless of ancestry, who manifest this strange miasma are happily adopted into the family. Children born of this family who do not find themselves covered in cloying fog are quickly sent off the island.
The Olaf Family is descended from a clan of Azoicmound alchemists and brewers. Their ancient founder was accused of plotting against the core tenants of the country and her entire family was to be sent to death. They escaped and fled to the island, willing to risk its curse only to find they were not affected by it.
Lastly, there are the water dwelling Maelstrom Family. Originally from Levinea , their ancestor fell in love with one of the Nereids who lived near the cursed island. The original ancestor could not bear the curse and got sick often. But the Nereid crafted them a heart shaped amulet that protected them from both the Nereids touch and the curse of the island. When their children were born, they were innately able to withstand the islands‘ curse.
Polris

places/avasoryd/crystalwaters/crystalwat.title: Crystalwaters
places/avasoryd/crystalwaters/crystalwat.description: Crystalwater is entirely surrounded by mountains and the country Tawdrywilde. The inhabitants of the nation are quite secluded. They draw magic from the great lake of crystal in the center of the country. They are not unfriendly to outsiders but don’t facilitate travel into the country.

places/avasoryd/easterglen/easterglen.ht.title: Easterglen
places/avasoryd/easterglen/easterglen.ht.description:
Easterglen survives by supplying food to the mountain nations of Gold Rocks and Azoicmound. By having a relationship with both, a delicate balance is maintained between the two vastly stronger powers.
Recently, Netherrim has swept up from the south and taken quite a large chunk of farmland for itself, causing both the nearby mountain nations to emerge from their caverns and send troops to fight on the ground. This hasn’t abated the barely covert political scheming from the mountains, both trying to use the war as an opportunity to bring the Easterglen fully under their influence.
Calend
Encass

places/avasoryd/fallencall/blackspire.ht.title: Blackspire
places/avasoryd/fallencall/blackspire.ht.description: The capital city of Fallencall, ruled by the Blackfrost. It's leading export is of magical items.

places/avasoryd/fallencall/fallencall.ht.title: Fallencall
places/avasoryd/fallencall/fallencall.ht.description:
Fallencall emerged as part of the mage revolution of Ravenyard around the year 200 AC.
In the years after the Raven King's rule, Ravenyard nobility began to elevate mages from the common people to their courts in order to leverage their arcane power against each other. They preferred wizards specifically, because of their versatility. They were not treated fairly in most courts, more as commoner tools to achieve a means to an end. They were encouraged not only to serve their noble lords without question, but to fight and die for them.Around the year 200AC, several noble lords brought their mages with them to a clandestine meeting in the east of the country. At this fateful meeting, the mages were left to their own devices while the Lords drank and made merry, the tradition of wizards being anything less than loyal servants long forgotten, it struck these individuals that the mages they’d been fighting on behalf of their lord were actually the same as they were. Not evil, but pressed into service.These individuals stayed in contact, building networks of court mages. Then, one fateful day, almost all of the court mages in the country revolted. They cut the county clean in two with ease. Claiming the area known as Fallencall for themselves.The attitude of elevating mages from the common people bled into the very foundations of Fallencall. With their newfound independence, the wizards chose to rule above the common people. They separated the country loosely, giving territory to each powerful mage who participated. The mages had no higher authority to answer to, nor any duty to the villages the country happened to swallow up. This lawlessness granted them the freedom to live as they pleased, but also lead to chaos and confusion for those without aptitude for magic.Almost immediately, the wizards descended into infighting. Using powerful magic to exact their rules on other mages and fighting against other mages. Use of the Wish spell particularly was prevalent in this period. The fighting ravaged the country, changing its very geography and leaving it quite unusual and broken up. When it was down to a handful of the most reasonable or strong wizards, they met together and decided upon a set of accords. If one wizard were to violate the rules, they would face retribution from all the other ruling wizards. This included banning of the wish spell for uses beyond the recreation of other spells.Aside from following the provisions, each wizard was free to rule his land and his people as he saw fit. Wizard Lords often raise apprentices out from the common folk, while being careful not to teach them too much. Eventually, one of their apprentices becomes as strong and more clever than they are, and they’re replaced. The new Wizard Lord is then free to reshape his domain as he sees fit.Most Wizard Lords keep their populace healthy and educated, understanding it is in their best interest. Some do not care, using people for cheap labor and discard them, preventing them from escaping through arcane means. These Wizard Lords are usually disposed up when eventually their tyranny combined with the magic that seeps into the very soil of the country to produce a powerful champion of the people.
Blackspire
Bredani
Frosthold

places/avasoryd/gold-rocks/gold-rocks.ht.title: Gold Rocks
places/avasoryd/gold-rocks/gold-rocks.ht.description:
This mountain country has been ruled by a line of Gold Dragons, The Aurum, since anyone can recall. Many people dwell both on the mountain and within it, bowing to the might of the Aurum. Many Kobolds and lesser dragons live here, but the land is open to all. Those that find themselves estranged or suffocated in Azoicmound often move here where the law is much more relaxed.
Drakemere
The Seat of Draconic Might

places/avasoryd/gold-rocks/the-seat-of-d.title: The Seat of Draconic Might
places/avasoryd/gold-rocks/the-seat-of-d.sourcePath: Places/Avasoryd/Gold Rocks/The Seat of Draconic Might.md

places/avasoryd/halcystead/halcystead.ht.title: Halcystead
places/avasoryd/halcystead/halcystead.ht.description:
Halcystead used to be a peaceful land ruled by the Halcy Family, until the Sanguine Queen rose up from the local nobility around the year 300. She started at the top of the island with a single settlement and has slowly been encroaching more and more.
The Order of the Pale now functionally rules what is left of Halcystead, fighting off constant encroachments of undead and monstrous beasts. Few civilians actually remain in the country anymore, they either fled to Welterglow and beyond, or have been drafted to support the centuries long war effort.

places/avasoryd/hazelden/hazelden.html.title: Hazelden
places/avasoryd/hazelden/hazelden.html.description:
Around the fall of Netherrim, Hazelden broke off from Thaumdeep and retreated to the forest.Their founder fought in the Great War and fled along with a number of refugees. They swore off meddling with natural order through advances in technology. Instead they live in harmony with nature, considering primal magic to be the only acceptable magic. Worked metal specifically is fully outlawed within Hazelden. Outsiders who lay down their arms and prove they aren’t bringing any metal or magic into the forest are begrudgingly allowed entrance.
Greyoves
Grimwood

places/avasoryd/levinea/levinea.html.title: Levinea
places/avasoryd/levinea/levinea.html.description: This city is the undisputed underwater capital. The seas of Avasoryd are known to be extremely dangerous, but this city state is the bastion of light among the darkness.Azerketi have lived and ruled here since as long as anyone can recall. There is even magic throughout the city that allows air breathing creatures to reside here safely. Many merchants hire Levinean guards to protect their ships from underwater and the city is a thriving trade hub.Recently the city has shut itself off completely from outsiders. The city has disabled the magics that allowed ships to dock above the underwater city and their crews to travel down.

places/avasoryd/lunahelm-raiders/lunahel.title: Lunahelm Raiders
places/avasoryd/lunahelm-raiders/lunahel.description:
The Lunahelm Raiders are defined by their belief in the survival of the fittest. While there are still farmers and settlers in the Raiders, they’re looked down upon compared to the Raiders. These folks mostly consisted of conquered peoples who don’t ascribe to the Blood and Brine need for sailing and violence. They worship The Druidic Order of Blood and Brine, which places emphasis on reincarnation. If one is in an an unfortunate situation, it’s because they weren’t brave enough in a past life. Ones misery and weakness is brought upon themselves. Farming and settling is a waste of time when you could be proving your bravery in hunt and battle to the Gods.A specific massive point of contention and conflict is The Druidic Order of Blood and Brine believes that killing The Chosen will grant ones family incredible luck and benefits in future reincarnations.
Ethlow

places/avasoryd/necromere/necromere.html.title: Necromere
places/avasoryd/necromere/necromere.html.description:
Necromere is the domain of the Sanguine Queen, and she’s been building the domain for around 300 years.Despite the Sanguine Queen's ruthlessness, life in the north of Necromere is mostly normal. Aside from the occasional zombie or crusader burning villages down, as long as peasants don’t cause problems for her and her army, she treats them relatively well. As long as she still has the blood of crusaders to keep her youth and they don’t think about rebelling, there are no issues. She’s even so kind as to order her undead to rebuild the villages that her army tears through on the conquest of the south.
Anceen

places/avasoryd/netherrim/netherrim.html.title: Netherrim
places/avasoryd/netherrim/netherrim.html.description:
The exact details of how Netherrim was destroyed are lost to time. During the great Founding War, The Holy Order of the Lawful Patriarch formed the The Great, Holy, and Pious Alliance of Kingdoms to fight off the warriors of what is now known as Netherrim.This land was once a vibrant alliance of city-states, that were allegedly quite culturally and technologically advanced. Of course, no such proof of this exists in the current day. Apparently, winning the war required every Chosen of the time to join together against them. Many of the events of this war are likely more metaphorical than factual. For example, their Iron War Titans were likely Giants wearing plate mail.At the end of the war, the entire region was desolated, the fertile soils and teaming corral reefs completely wiped from the map. This is likely due to a combination of factors, including soil erosion and other natural phenomena. It seems equally unlikely that a war could truly have this destructive power.Those that survived the war formed a number of separate clans or tribes in order to survive in the wasteland. Due to its complete lack of resources and defensive positions, no pre-existing country claimed a stake in the land. This area was dubbed the Netherrim Waste around 0 BC. There has been silence from the region until the few decades.
A decade ago, an unknown but charismatic leader marched on Easterglen, taking a massive chunk out of the southern farmlands. He had spent quite some time uniting the various groups who'd adapted to survival in the wastes over the past centuries. The self-proclaimed Peoples of Netherrim have begun building cities and farms in the area, leading raids and conquering the territories of Gold Rocks, Easterglen, The Great, Holy, and Pious Alliance of Kingdoms, and up as far as Amberreach. The generals of the army know how to push heavy terrain advantage that they have in the wastes over to the heavily armored, horse-reliant, or sea-faring armies of their armies.
Old Lonford

places/avasoryd/ravenyard/ravenyard.html.title: Ravenyard
places/avasoryd/ravenyard/ravenyard.html.description:
According to legend, Ravenyard was founded two millennia ago as the Kingdom of the Raven. The Raven King raised soldiers from the darkness and swept through almost all of the North, his territory bounded only by the Dwarven mountain tribes to the South, the ancestors of the Lunahelm Raiders to the West. The territory covered most of what is not Fallencall and Amberreach .According to records, he ruled for over a thousand years. Scholars hotly debate this fact as he did not appear in public nor remove his mask for a great deal of that time. During his rule, he slowly parceled off sections of his land to his children, allowing them to take their mother's name and append his surname - Jūn (君), meaning ruler.Each direct child of his formed their own noble house, with the intention that the eldest of descendants would serve on a ruling council. There were over 30 recognized noble families at the time of the Raven King's abdication. The ensuing wars and infighting significantly weakened the country. Over the last millennia, this number has steeply declined. The mage revolt of the 200s also caused a high number of families to lose their lives, titles, or territories.In the current day, there are approximately a dozen noble families in good standing. They oversee the country with minimal public infighting. They follow a feudal system, leasing land to the peasantry. The quality of life of the average common person is dependent on the current lord's benevolence, although most of the wiser lords remain wary that their power is dependent on their people not rising up in anger. Those who are born or marry into any of the -Jun families live in luxury.
Ravenholm

places/avasoryd/tawdrywilde/tawdrywilde..title: Tawdrywilde
places/avasoryd/tawdrywilde/tawdrywilde..description:
Tawdrywild is a country full of magic and megafauna, located surrounding the mysterious Crystalwaters.
For unknown reasons, the plants and animals are incredibly large and ferocious. Temperatures also fluctuate strangely here. Even so, the people have carved out a number of cities from the dense forests. Simple magic is also enhanced in certain pockets of the island, making it the perfect place for a school of magic.
Arcanum
Lonake
University of Balance

places/avasoryd/thaumdeep/thaumdeep.html.title: Thaumdeep
places/avasoryd/thaumdeep/thaumdeep.html.description:
The Kingdom of Thaumdeep used to include a handful of underground settlements and a large expanse of sprawling countryside. Their domain included significant portion of what now belongs to Hazelden, Lunahelm Raiders, and The Great, Holy, and Pious Alliance of Kingdoms.On account of religious and ideological differences, the kingdom didn’t join the alliance of kingdoms around the year 0 and refuses to join to this day. Even while being driven further and further underground over the centuries, the monarchy won’t ally with any of the three nations its warring against.As of the last decade, the country has is now completely retreated to the mountainside and cave systems. The hastily dug tunnels are not the most sturdy, but at least the fighting has been contained to outside the mountain.
Vallora

places/avasoryd/the-great,-holy,-and-pio.title: The Great, Holy, and Pious Alliance of Kingdoms
places/avasoryd/the-great,-holy,-and-pio.description:
The Alliance of Kingdoms sprung from an agreement created in the war against Netherrim around the year 0. They were united against a great evil by a group of chosen. They understood immediately when the chosen told them of the beliefs of The Holy Order of the Lawful Patriarch and were United by belief.
Our great country is ruled by The Hand of the Lawful Patriarch. The Right Hand brings the nobility together and makes sure everyone’s interests are attended to. Quality of life in the Alliance is excellent, with a great deal of farmland, trade, and arts.
Stonehaven
Tehmia
places/avasoryd/the-great,-holy,-and-pio.sourcePath: Places/Avasoryd/The Great, Holy, and Pious Alliance of Kingdoms/The Great, Holy, and Pious Alliance of Kingdoms.md

places/avasoryd/the-grove-of-cycles/the-.title: The Grove of Cycles
places/avasoryd/the-grove-of-cycles/the-.description:
Long ago, The Grove of Cycles was traditionally only accessible to those who could travel through tree networks. Within the Grove it is said an ancient beast, as wise as he was good. Powerful Druids would go here to seek his wisdom and beseech his aid.During the tumultuous rule of The Raven King, many villagers of Ravenyard were displaced. The wise creature and his followers opened the river pass to allow them safe haven. When the Clans of Barrenbreak formed, those with a penchant for chaos found themselves restricted. The beast again allowed them to live within his domain. More recently, when the Lunahelm Raiders swept up the coast, the Druids opened the mountain pass and allowed them to join their home.Anyone is welcome to live in the Valley, so long as they are good and respectful of nature. The wise creature is considered now to be more of a metaphor for natures wisdom. The Grove itself is now a thriving city grown from trees and existing at one with the natural world.
Sylvoria
places/avasoryd/the-grove-of-cycles/the-.sourcePath: Places/Avasoryd/The Grove of Cycles/The Grove of Cycles.md

places/avasoryd/valane/valane.html.title: Valane
places/avasoryd/valane/valane.html.description: Valane is a closed off city-state in the middle of the battle between Thaumdeep and The Great, Holy, and Pious Alliance of Kingdoms. Both countries regularly try to invade Valane to no success.Valane has mysterious technology they use to repel any attacking forces, for some reason however, they do not take the offensive.

places/avasoryd/welterglow/welterglow.ht.title: Welterglow
places/avasoryd/welterglow/welterglow.ht.description:
Welterglow has been the trade capitol of Avasoyrd for the last 600 or so years.It’s currently run by a coalition of Merchant Lords and is politically focused entirely on economic growth at any cost. The mindset that anyone could become a Merchant Lord with enough luck and hard word is incredibly core to the countries belief and keeps the populate in check.
Right now, the Merchant Lords are generally focused on “helping” Amberreach, trading with The Great, Holy, and Pious Alliance of Kingdoms, and offering any remaining citizens of Halcystead help to the mainland (they can work the cost of it off later).
Cu'Onda Compound
Starhaven

then we explored the rest of Vosnan's tower we found 6k gold paintings! 3 paintings of vosnan and friends :) A young Vosnan stands smiling with a group of other young hobgoblins, they hold a staff. Fires burn in the background of the portrait. Beside the groups are a nephilim with a face of red and black patterns, a cheerful gnome, and a some sort of deer creature. The caption reads “debut of the 2nd cohort”
the back says Vosnan, Dynst, Lucas Judkins, Elkavron A much more dour Vosnan, among a group of young folk. In the center sits an skeleton, covered in gemstones and with runes carved into his bones. Two identical blonde boys, maybe early 20 at the latest smile. One has longer hair and a glint of mischief, the other stands behind the long haired boy looking quite shy. A woman in her late 20s smiles brightly, serpents fangs visible at the corner of her mouth. A tall elf with a yellow robe holds a hand up in greeting. “Lord of Runic Pride’s Apprentices”
the back says Vosnan, Caius Thaine, Caelus, Lord of Runic Pride, Anva, Innirro This portrait shows one of the blonde boys, grim and scarred now, standing in the center. Vosnan is there scowling now. A blue kenku sits lazily on a stool. The raven haired woman smiles with appropriate decorum and no warmth. A young red kobold stands with arms crossed and brow ridge furrowed. A pale figure with large dark circled eyes blends into the background.
“Formation of the Blackfrost”

Frostford - full of undead, and there is a portal. things seem generally grim, icky, covered in frost. looks perhaps a little bit more rundown but otherwise the same.
"Caelus Thaine, caius' twin- or, was. he died when we tried to take over shit from the bonelord guy. lord of pride or whatever. caius never really got over that. they were pretty much identical twins except reversed." don't think it's a chain of reflections "caius has made a new brother and is waiting for you to get strong enough so he can do some ritual situation." why didnt he ressurect his brother? answer: "one, i think the guy doesnt want to come back. or he cant do it without a wish ritual. casting it with a wish ritual would be a huge problem and get everyone up his ass." "when his brother died he started talking to himself like he used to talk to his brother (like talking to his reflection)." "i dont think caius ever thought of caelus of a person, more of an extension of himself"
"their mom was someone they were protecting, don't know what happened to her but she wasnt a fan of the caelus stuff" (roughly that) "some strange metal elemental was summoned a few days ago in the capital and tried to attack caius. he said he had some people to talk to things with and went to his teleportation circle. havent heard from him since." nobody in the capital has seen him since then. why does he make you runelords, specifically. answer: "the runelord is the only tradition he's ever known. once the lord of runic pride died and we continued the tradition. until sinani, and talked about challenges and journeys and said that you'd need a challenge but not too hard." [insert caius aeon stones list] "really suddenly spiked in power, hasn't always been this powerful" figured it out under lord of runic pride. went away a little bit in the mountains and was like oh yeah i can make zombies out of frost that can explode. has been perfecting it since then. they dont have it but pretty much everybody else does.

Yivin: more ppl came to them for healing, accidentally made a hospital! druids came to help purify the well water because it was making ppl sick! D'volta: decided to take a break to teleport to the edge of the world, oh shit theres an edge of the world. teleports around if you hit it. theres a center to the world, there isnt supposed to be! world is 4000miles in radius in hemisphere, maybe sphere, yet to confirm downward direction. giant guardian beasts that dont like ppl messing with it. extremely high level magic, check it out later? center is in the tristate area!

She a ghorran, has a plant creature for an eidolon. theyve been fighting devils in the plane of earth, but the devils have become very busy with something else. elowan was lonely and talked to the mirror, and thats how lillyanna came about by being dragged out there. new friend and ally for planar stuffs! :D Yivin: safehouse is safe! druid that came down decided to stay and help with the hospital!
Korkau: finally parted ways, and established bffs forever. korkau can call him up if ever need to. buddy is Aijinghou Vani: village is turning more into a city now! so many ppl here! they decide it needs a name, so they named it Stonehaven in honor of vani :D (cries). he learned how to bake bread! dropped off with Varial Arden in the form of a woman she carries it up the mountain, dangerous, goes thru tunnels and caves looks annoyed abt it the whole time tbh arrives at a small flat plateau at the top of the mountain, as if the top of the mountain was cut off inscribed with long faded runes and symbols, mossy and craggy agreed to cast illusory scene so we can see it happening varial waits and the rocks begin to move, and they shake off the moss and dirt since the last time they stood up a giant lizard with big wings & gold scales, a dragon, awakens "ahh, little devil what brings you here?" "theres a group that thinks they can break the seal, im here to show them that they cannot" "ahh, good, yes, show the runes" he sits up to show the entrance of a cave varial enters, it is covered in ancient paintings, color mostly faded but still visual 8 beings fighting off a great creature, beings on 1 side, spells and weapons, great heroes creature on opposite side, massive darkness with many arms, swarms of smaller creatures crawl from the sea & shambling creatures covered in blue crystals the heroes seal the creature away because they couldnt defeat it, and the symbols of our gods are shown on the beings the translucent forms of the figures are on their bodies the heroes are generally becloaked its hard to make out, youd have to go there to restore the painting one who has a light pink cloak, with the symbol of a half sun on the back A S I some of the inscriptions have letters under them, the figures are labeled arent super clear dragon must be more than a thousand years old "What's depicted in the cave you're guarding?" This is the Great Sacrifice that saved many worlds. An important and cautionary tale. Throughout history it's common enough that the Chosen It seems like the last 600 years the Chosen have been kept super weak and not kept together
As soon as the The Holy Order of the Lawful Patriarch gets everyone together, the marks jump around It was very common for a group to be chosen and they would rise to great power, but not do anything with that power, or be corrupted, or be hunted down by their friend, the raiders interfere a lot Sometimes a group would get lost in the mountains "How old are you? (dragon)" I'm from the... dawn of time (unsure inflection?) The timeline goes past 1k, but gets funky the earlier in age so ppl think there just wasnt a lot of stuff You can find ruins from before 1k years, but they're very very destroyed There's scriptures of the gods from before who would intervene "The Lady of Art"

Valane impeccably clean, many automatons and robots without souls Sometimes people go by, hurrying by Human and Elven-ish Seem to be a couple large families

misc/eternal-lantern.html.title: Eternal Lantern
misc/eternal-lantern.html.description: This minor artifact is an immobile object gifted to the town of Willowshore by the founder of the Tan Sugi Monastery, Zhi Hui. For the town’s entire history, the Eternal Lantern has stood sentinel near the settlement’s heart, its light never wavering after Zhi Hui placed a few copper coins within it. Some believe that it’s possible to receive blessings from the deities whose shrines stand in Willowshore by placing copper coins within the Eternal Lantern in exchange for additional protection, but for the most part, the people of Willowshore have become used to the ever-burning lantern at the southern steps of Dawnstep Bridge.

places/willowshore/downtown-willowshore/.title: Downtown Willowshore
places/willowshore/downtown-willowshore/.description:
Downtown Willowshore remains a major hub of activity in town. To the northeast stands the Governor's Home and office, which also serves as the village’s bank and treasury. South of the manor lie the Imperial Barracks, commanded by Zheng Peng (male human watch officer). To the north of the crossroad is the stage for the village’s weekly Shu Opera performance, which is part of the Seven-Colored Songbird Theater, a venue officiated over by Kazuma Oono (male kitsune director). Nearby on opposite sides of the road is one of Willowshore’s busiest stores, Treesparrow’s Rest, and Willowshore’s only public bathhouse, the Happy Kappa. Treesparrow’s is a family-owned grocery store run by Sanmi Nadoya (female human family matriarch), while the Happy Kappa’s owner, De-Ge Hua (male halfling bathhouse owner) is famous in town for his obsession with cleanliness. Wares: alcohol, bathing, entertainment, grains, household supplies and tools, preserved foods, rations
Governor's Home

Imperial Barracks
Seven-Colored Songbird Theater
Treesparrow’s Rest
